column1: {{Cleanup}}<!-- Broad reference section should be replaced by legitimate citations -->
:''All dates in this section are approximate. Calculated Sun years for the Years of the Lamps and the Trees are rounded to the nearest year.''<ref group="Note">One [[Valian Years
column2: Valian Year]] is equal to 9.582 Sun Years.</ref>
rules="all" style="border:1px solid darkgrey; border-collapse:collapse" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" width="100%"

column7: Marring of Arda]].
Melkor]] flees.

column6: The completion of [[Arda]]. The [[Valar]] create the [[Two Lamps]] and settle at [[Almaren]]. '''''Beginning of the [[Spring of Arda]].'''''

column7: Melkor]] secretly returns to [[Arda]], raises the [[Iron Mountains]] and delves [[Utumno]], and partly blights the [[Spring of Arda]].
Melkor]] overthrows the [[Two Lamps]] forming [[Helcar]] and [[Sea of Ringil
column8: Ringil]]. [[Almaren]] is destroyed. In order to preserve life on the earth, [[Yavanna]] sets most living things into a [[Sleep of Yavanna
column9: long sleep]]. '''''End of the [[Spring of Arda]].'''''

column6: The [[Valar]] raise the [[Pelóri]] and settle in [[Aman]]. The [[Two Trees]] are grown in [[Valinor]].

column2: rules="all" style="border:1px solid darkgrey; border-collapse:collapse" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" width="100%"

column7: [[Morgoth
column8: Melkor]] sleeps in [[Utumno]].  [[Oromë]] hunts throughout [[Middle-earth]]. Melkor raises the [[Misty Mountains

column6: About some time before the waking of the Elves, [[Aulë]] creates the 7 [[Fathers of the Dwarves]] and their 6 spouses. Ilúvatar adopts them and they are put to sleep.

column7: The [[Valar]] hold council, for [[Yavanna]] and [[Oromë]] report that Melkor might rise once more in power.  They discuss the [[Children of Ilúvatar]].  [[Varda]] begins to fashion new stars, and organize them and those already wrought into [[:Category:Constellations
column8: constellations]], over the next fifty years.

column7: [[Varda]] forms the [[Valacirca]]. '''The first 144 [[Elves]] ([[Minyar]], [[Tatyar]], and [[Nelyar]]) awake in [[Cuiviénen]].''' [[Melian]] travels to [[Beleriand]] after ascending [[Taniquetil]] to see the stars.

column6: Spies of Melkor discover the Elves and afflict them. Possibly [[Orcs]] first created.

column7: [[Oromë]] discovers the [[Elves]], and calls them [[Eldar]].  The Eldar are afraid of Oromë, and blame him for [[Morgoth
[[Oromë]] returns to [[Valinor]], and witnesses to his peers about the Children of Ilúvatar.  Oromë returns to the [[Elves]] while the Valar consider his message.
[[Valar]] make war on [[Morgoth
column8: Melkor]] in the [[War for Sake of the Elves]]. The earth is shaken. The shores of Beleriand are formed and bays are created on the North. Over the next two years Melkor is defeated, and retreats into [[Utumno]].

column7: The [[Siege of Utumno]] begins. North is desolated and the Sea widened.
The [[Siege of Utumno]] ends, as the Valar storm the final defenses. Balrogs attack and Manwë slays them. [[Tulkas]] captures [[Morgoth
column8: Melkor]], binding him with [[Angainor]]. [[Sauron]] evades capture.

column7: [[Morgoth]] is brought back to Valinor, judged and cast into [[Mandos]].
Valar make council about the protection of Eruhíni and decide to bring them to Valinor. Oromë Invites the Elves.
Elves are unwilling so Oromë invites the three Elven ambassadors, [[Ingwë]], [[Finwë]] and [[Elwë]] to come to Valinor.
Ambassadors return to [[Cuiviénen]] and invite the Elves to return with them to Valinor.

First [[Sundering of the Elves]] at [[Cuiviénen]]. [[Vanyar]] under Ingwë, [[Noldor]] under Finwë and [[Teleri]] under Elwë and [[Olwë]]. [[Avari]], under [[Morwë]] and [[Nurwë]], stay in Cuiviénen.
The [[Eldar]] depart, pass [[Sea of Helcar]] and turn west. Some are terrified by the smokes of war and go back.
Second [[Sundering of the Elves]]: The host pass [[Mirkwood
column8: Greenwood]] the Great and come to the River [[Anduin]]. Some Lindar wish to stay there. Terrified by the [[Misty Mountains
column10: a part]] of them go south led by [[Lenwë]].

column7: [[Vanyar]] and [[Noldor]] enter [[Beleriand]]; the foremost of them pass [[Sirion]] and reach the shores. Oromë goes to Aman for counsel.
The unwilling Teleri also come to Beleriand and dwell east of [[Gelion]]. Elwë keeps friendship with Finwë and Noldor on the west.
Elwë returning from a meeting with Finwë meets Melian in [[Nan Elmoth]] and falls into a trance.
[[Ulmo]] brings [[Tol Eressëa
column8:
an island]] to the [[Bay of Balar]]. The Vanyar and Noldor forget their fear for the Sea and embark upon it while the Teleri look for Elwë.
When departing, the island breaks and leaves the [[Isle of Balar]] behind.

column1: After learning of their embark, some Teleri led by Olwë, reach the shores and meet [[Ossë]] and [[Uinen]].

column7: [[Vanyar]] and [[Noldor]] enter [[Valinor]] and build [[Eldamar]]. The Valar open the rift [[Calacirya]] in Pelóri so that the [[Light of Valinor]] reaches Eldamar. The Elves begin the building of [[Tirion]] on the hill [[Túna]] inside Calacirya.
[[Vanyar]] and [[Noldor]] found [[Tirion]] and [[Mindon Eldaliéva]]. Some Vanyar yearn for the Trees and go closer to Valinor.
[[Galathilion
column8: White Tree]] given to [[Noldor]] by Yavanna.

column7: Finwë prays to Ulmo to bring the Teleri. However Ossë is grieved and persuades some to stay with him. [[Círdan]] with some establish the havens of [[Brithombar]] and [[Eglarest]]. [[Ossë]] teaches them shipcraft.
Olwë and the [[Falmari
column8: most part]] of the Teleri leave Beleriand. The rest of the Teleri are still looking for Elwë and are named [[Eglath]].

column7: Tol Eressëa with the Teleri stops moving outside the [[Bay of Eldamar]]. They are afterwards named Falmari who choose to remain on [[Tol Eressëa]].
[[Elwë]] awakens from the trance and becomes King of Elves in [[Beleriand]]; his hair is now silver.
The Falmari after the teachings of Ossë build ships. They leave Tol Eressëa and come to Valinor.
[[Teleri]] found [[Alqualondë]] with the help of Finwë.
All the Vanyar depart from Tirion to Taniquetil and Noldor stay with the Falmari.
Birth of [[Fëanor]] son of Finwë and [[Míriel]]. The Noldor are taught by Aulë labouring and love the jewels. [[Rúmil (elf of Tirion)
column8: Rúmil of Tirion]] makes the [[Sarati]] and possibly writes the [[Ainulindalë (song)

column7: Death of [[Míriel
[[Statute of Finwë and Míriel
[[Finwë]] weds [[Indis]].
Birth of [[Fingolfin]].
Second Age of Chaining of Melkor: [[Lúthien]] born in [[Neldoreth]].
Birth of [[Finarfin]].

[[Fëanor]] creates the [[Tengwar]].
[[Dwarves]] enter [[Beleriand]] and meet the [[Sindar]].
[[Finarfin]] weds [[Eärwen]].

Third Age of Chaining of Melkor: births of [[Turgon]] and [[Finrod]].
[[Dwarves of Belegost]] and Elves begin the building of [[Menegroth]] in [[Doriath]]. The Dwarves are paid with knowledge from Melian and with many pearls, including [[Nimphelos]]. [[Daeron]] creates the [[Cirth
[[Orcs]] first seen in [[Beleriand]]; Dwarves make weapons for the Sindar.
[[Denethor (Nando)
column8: Denethor]] leads some of the [[Nandor]] into Beleriand and befriends Thingol. They settle in [[Ossiriand]]. Daeron betters the Cirth, which are adopted by the Dwarves and made known east of the [[Blue Mountains]].

column7: Births of [[Galadriel]] and [[Aredhel]].
[[Morgoth]] released from bondage.
[[Morgoth]] befriends the [[Noldor]].
[[Fëanor]] having invented the substance [[Silima]] begins constructing the [[Silmarils]],

'''[[Fëanor]] completes the [[Silmarils]]; he puts the Light of the Trees in them and Varda hallows them.'''
For the next 20 years Melkor begins spreading strife and talking about weapons.
The Valar summon Fëanor who threatens Fingolfin with his sword. They exile him to [[Formenos]] and Finwë follows.
Melkor visits Fëanor but he repels him. Finwë then warns the Valar and begins to pursue Melkor. Melkor hides and meets [[Ungoliant]] in [[Avathar]].

Fëanor is commanded by Manwë to Taniquetil where he and Fingolfin reconcile. '''Ungoliant destroys the Two Trees, Morgoth kills Finwë in Formenos and steals the Silmarils.''' They flee to Beleriand where they debate. Balrogs arrive and drive Ungoliant away. Morgoth stays in [[Angband]] and raises the [[Thangorodrim]].

column1: '''Fëanor begins the rebellion and goes to Alqualondë where he [[First Kinslaying
column2: fights with the Falmari]] and steals their swanships. The Flight of the Noldor begins.'''

column7: [[Mandos]] (or his messenger) appears before the Noldor and speaks the [[Doom of Mandos]]. Finarfin with some repent and return to Valinor where he is accepted. Finrod his son becomes the leader of his house and follows Fëanor.
[[First Battle of Beleriand]]. Death of [[Denethor (Nando)
column8: Denethor]], besiegement of the [[Havens of the Falas]]. Thingol withdraws his people and the [[Girdle of Melian]] is set around Doriath. The Laiquendi from now on remain hidden and take no other king.

column1: The Noldor arrive at [[Helcaraxë]], but Fëanor and his people betray Fingolfin and sail to Beleriand. '''Burning of the ships at [[Losgar]]. [[Dagor-nuin-Giliath]] ("Battle-under-Stars"). Fëanor is mortally wounded by [[Gothmog (balrog)
column2: Gothmog]] and is rescued by his sons before dying in sight of the [[Thangorodrim]].''' [[Maedhros]] meets with Morgoth under a false truce, his forces are too few and he is captured.

column7: [[Maedhros]] is chained to the [[Thangorodrim]]. The Noldor do not depart as demanded by Morgoth and instead make a great camp at [[Mithrim]].

'''Creation of [[Moon]] and [[Sun]]. The host of the [[Noldor]] finishes crossing the [[Helcaraxë]] and enters [[Beleriand]] under [[Fingolfin]].''' [[Battle of the Lammoth]] and death of [[Argon]]. The Moon rises and after seven times, the Sun follows.

column2: The Tale of Years]]'' (''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'')

column1: * ''[[The Grey Annals]]'' (''[[The War of the Jewels]]'')

column2: Unfinished Tales of Númenor and Middle-earth]]''
